headline: Carrot Cake
description: This carrot cake is tender and moist with a delicious homemade cream cheese frosting. Perfect for Easter or a crowd-pleasing potluck dessert.
name: Carrot Cake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x13 inch pan.

Beat sugar, oil, eggs, and 2 teaspoons vanilla together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until well combined. Mix in flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt. Stir in carrots. Fold in pecans. Pour into the prepared pan.

Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, about 40 minutes. Let cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack and cool completely.

To make the frosting: Beat butter, cream cheese, confectioners' sugar, and 1 teaspoon vanilla together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy. Stir in chopped pecans. Frost the cooled cake.

review.reviewBody: Awesome!

The best carrot cake! I got rave reviews, and the only tweak I made was a little more vanilla in the frosting. Prior to this, Costcoâ€™s carrot cake was the best for me. Now itâ€™s been knocked out of 1st place. ðŸ˜‹
I made this today, came out terrible, so hard and dense. Sunk in the middle. I watched the video and followed directions exactly. What went wrong?

Amazingly moist cake! Made it for my daughters birthday as she is a carrot cake fan and everyone absolutely loved it! I made a couple of adjustments to the icing recipe but the cake itself was lovely! Will definitely make this one again in the future!
Best carrot cake recipe Iâ€™ve tried big hit will definitely make again
I love this recipe, itâ€™s the only one I use. Iâ€™m making it right now, delicious
I made this cake for my uncles birthday, and he is a bit of a carrot cake snob. He loved it and told me he would like this cake every year! It was so moist and amazing.
This recipe was really good, though I didn't make the frosting, the cake itself is great. I cut on the sugar, but that's a tiny detail. Highly suggest this recipe!
Easy recipe and delicious !
Made this w/o nuts , it is the best carrot cake I have ever made
This recipe is fabulous. Only difference I did was add a little more pecans. My husband took it to work. Everybody raved over it. Was eaten up quickly. Great recipe.

I made this for Thanksgiving and it was a hit. My brother said he thought we got it from a bakery. Now my mom asks me to make this for her whenever she craves it. My only suggestion is to let it bake for maybe 55 mins to an hour when cooking in a 9x13 pan. Iâ€™ve made it multiple times and each time they were still wet in the middle which caused the cake to drop from opening the oven. I would recommend baking it for 55 mins then let it sit in the oven unopened until it cools. Just made it again right now and opened it after 45 mins and it was still not ready. Let it cook another 10 and it was fine but the middle dropped. Iâ€™m going to try baking it a little longer and cooling in the unopened oven and hope this stops it from dropping in the center.

My partner loves this recipe. But we like to add another teaspoon of vanilla, an extra stick of butter , and replace the Carrots with bananas and sprinkle chocolate ships on top. Yum!! This is the best recipe ever!!
My husband's ultimate favourite cake. I add usually a little more cinnamon and vanilla and Alot more carrots. Tastes great everytime!

First of all, I was concerned about some of the ingredients listed. But I found that making the recipe and tasting it was fabulous. I implemented adding the below: 1/4-c vegetable oil, a 1/2 stick more butter, 1/3-c heavy cream, and walnuts. Cream cheese frosting topped with more walnuts. Superb!
Iâ€™m getting requests from friends to make this cake. I add 1/4 cup pineapple juice with eggs into cake batter.

My son in law made this cake for a family birthday and it was awesome. He baked it in a 9 x 13 -inch pan and then cut in half and made a layer cake using the frosting as suggested. It was so moist and flavorful. He substituted walnuts for pecans as that is all they had,
Best ever. One caveat, my carrots turned green. This happens if you use too much baking soda itâ€™s recommended to use 1/4 teaspoon less.
I think there's too much baking soda without an acidic element to balance it. Not happy about the aftertaste.

I have been making this for years. It's always a huge hit and DEVOURED within minutes! I follow the recipe exactly as written. It's easy, DELICIOUS and the only carrot cake recipe I will continue to make. A MUST try!!!

Try using aluminum free baking powder, you won't taste it. I always par boil the grated carrots before adding to cake batter. We like golden raisins in the cake, so I add 1/2 cups that have been softened in warm water,
In a good way, I donâ€™t recommend this all- took much baking soda and powder collapsed in the center - donâ€™t know how it got 5 stars
oh my god. really good cake you can use less than half the sugar for the frosting and it's great.
Used the recipe exactly as written and ALL we could taste was baking soda. Absolutely awful, inedible cake. I do not understand these reviews saying it is good. DO NOT ATTEMPT.

Way too much baking soda and baking powder. I'm not a pro baker, but I'm an experienced and confident home baker. My cake came out completely collapsed in the center. It turns out that all the baking soda/powder makes the cake rise too much so that it can't support itself and ends up collapsing. I think it would depend on what pan you used to make it in, but I found that some of the cake had some strong baking soda flavor. There are definitely better recipes on this website for carrot cake.

I have made this cake on several occasions and the recipe turns out delicious every time. This is not your store bought carrot cake. I do toast the pecans coated in butter before time, for the cake and the frosting. Gives it a little something something.
This was by far the nicest carrot cake I have ever tasted was simple to make and the icing topped it off nicely
I used this recipe many times and have rave reviews everytime, thanks for sharing your delicious recipe! It's 5 stars in my books

I love this cake. It tastes amazing. Only thing that sucks is the frosting recipe, it becomes too runny because the instructions say that you should mix everything together. DON'T! You need to beat fist the butter and the cheesecream and when they're properly incorporated you add the sugar slowly and stop beating as soon as it is properly incorporated. The problem is the sugar meeting the cheesecream directly, that's why it becomes runny. When you mix butter and the cheesecream first the butter prevents it from happening. And then put the frosting in the fridge for a while, so it doesn't melt.

This my first time making carrot cake and the recipe was very easy to follow. The cake was moist and full of flavor. The only issue was it didnâ€™t rise in the middle and I have no idea why. I followed every direction to the letter.
Too much baking soda,
Great recipe! First time making a carrot cake from scratch. Thank you, we all enjoyed it very much for our daughters birthday!

First time making carrot cake and it turned out perfectly! I didn't have the tin required so used a ring tin and I only had hazelnuts instead of pecans. I forgot to add them to the batter so sprinkled them over the cream cheese frosting. Was an absolutely delicious cake. Will be making this again and again.
i did do a bit of a sunstitute and used 1/2 coconut oil with vegetable oil and no nuts.
I always use this recipe and it always turnd out great! I absolutely love this and so does my family. Try it out :D
I love how moist it is! I used 1 cup brown sugar, 1 cup white sugar; and it has a rich flavor and a very moist cake! Thanks for the recipe!

Great recipe! Made as is. What I love most about the recipe is that the nutritional information is provided... I have an athlete in our home so it's super helpful for me to be able to provide fresh food and info as well as a treat now and then. Just a thought... As much as I can appreciate any tweaks or personal touches it would be helpful to indicate if cook time was altered as well... ie adding extra c. Carrot would have been perfect for me as I had them on hand, but do I bake it longer? All these things go into a great recipe....
This recipe is fabulous. I made it exactly as written and it has been a favorite of my family for years. I even make it for my vegan granddaughter by using an egg substitute.

This was a hit with the family. I reduced the amount of oil by about 1/2 cup. I also used stevia in place of sugar. The frosting on this cake was phenomenal. Light and fluffy, with excellent cream cheese flavor.
I've been making this cake for years! I have not changed anything in it. My family loves it, and quests have commented that its the best carrot cake they have ever eaten.
Was pretty bland, did not taste like carrot, more like a spice cake. I should have read the reviews before following the recipe
First time trying the recipe. I followed as stated. My cake turned out delicious! Moist and light! Thank you for sharing! Please keep on sharing new ones!
Such an easy recipe delicious, only change no pecans, we are that family doesnâ€™t like nuts on or in baked goods, itâ€™s us problem lol.
I've never made a carrot cake before. Recipe was easy to follow and it turned out DELICIOUS!!
It was awful I couldnâ€™t taste the carrot I flour the pan every thing it came out a crumble.

I don't understand how this recipe got so many good reviews. I made this step my step without changing any ingredients. Not only did my cake not rise in the middle, but it was completely inedible. The taste of oil and baking powder was so overpowering that even my husband wouldn't eat it. I consider myself an avid baker and started to blame myself until I read other similar reviews. Because of this, I learned to read reviews and not try something based off of stars alone.
very simple to put together and bakes up beautifully every time!

I did alter the cake. I used 3.4 c canola oil. 1/2 c unsweetened apple sauce instead of the vegetable oil. 1 c white sugar. 1 c brown sugar and added nutmeg. I mirrored one of the reviews and have been following this review for years. I've altered this recipe for diabetics and it is a hit every time.
Double batch in 4 8-inch pans:) Got sooooo many compliments! This is definitely my go-to recipe. A crowd-pleaser.

I found this recipe to be dry and flavorless so I decided to do the thing that so many people on this website hate; I took advice from other reviewers and made changes to the recipe on my second and third try. The advice I took from others is the only reason the cake now comes out perfectly moist, flavorful, and will be kept in my recipe book for generations to come. So here's the adjustments I made: I used 1 cup of apple sauce and 4 Tbs of oil, I upped the carrot amount to 4 cups, I upped the vanilla extract to 3 tsp, I upped the cinnamon to 2.5 tsp, and I added 1 tsp of nutmeg.
I don't even like carrot cake but this is amazing!! My husband has been looking for amazing carrot cake and this is it. Thank you so much!

I like this recipe. My first time making a carrot cake. I added a cup of crushed pineapple drained. And used two 10 in round pans and I made a half batch but it failed on my part. Not the recipe. Anyways I had some left over and put it in a 6 in round pan which turned out nicely. And I loved the way the cream cheese frosting turned out. Also my first time making cream cheese frosting
This is my go to carrot cake recipie. My son requests it every year for his birthday!
So many rave reviews and feedback from happy friends and family :) I could not believe that such a simple recipe would be so delicious. I used a mix of cashews and walnuts, and added a little nutmeg.
I love this recipe! It's delicious. I have a question, instead of using two 9inch pans, can I use 2 10inch pans? Or do would I need to make more batter?

great recipe, and very easy to make. however the amount of cake is too much for a normal cake size it needs to be changed to 12 people although doing this does not make a clean distribution of ingredients.
I donâ€™t usually comment or have reviews but this was a must. Best recipe ever

I loved it, my family loved it. However, I want something spicier. Should I kick it up with cloves, or what would be a good suggestion? Adding from another comment: upped the cinnamon to 2.5 tsps, added 1 tsp of nutmeg and 1 tsp of allspice, increased the carrots to 4 cups and the vanilla to 3 tsps
loved it... i didn't add the vanilla...
This recipe is fabulous. I didnâ€™t change a single thing & will make it again. Very moist. Thank you.
I have tried various carrot cake but this by far was my husband and my favorite! It was light, airy, moist and not too sweet. I chose to use brown sugar, raisins, and extra cinnamon.
Tastes amazing and pretty easy to make!
It was really good. Granddaughter (age 9) got tired of grating carrots. But after she had a piece, she said it was worth it. I do think it is too much frosting though.

The perfect carrot cake. I make it exactly as the recipe calls for. My family and friends all rave over it and ask for the recipe. I'll double the recipe and cook it in 5 x 9" circular pans for 35 minutes and make a 5 layer cake. If you do this, be sure to line the bottom of the pan with parchment paper (otherwise this cake will STICK to the bottom).
Made cake for husband's b-day. I added allspice, cinnamon, ginger. They all loved it!
It was good

I've never made carrot cake before and this lived up to the great ratings. While I agree with others who posted here that tweaking a recipe THEN rating it can lose the purpose of rating the item, I made it exactly as described BUT substituted a Truvia blend (75% stevia/ 25% sugar) instead of the regular sugar for the base and confections sugar for the topping. It was spectacular!

I'm a big time Baker and I have made several carrot cakes. I made this one the other day and everyone said this is the best they've ever had in their life. I did not change one thing. I really don't care if you change this recipe to fit your liking but I don't think you should be allowed to rate. You should start your own blog with a completely different recipe if you want to start changing this one.

Iâ€™m not sure how to rate this recipe. I made it exactly like it said. The ONLY thing I did was double the recipe. It was so hard to stir because the batter was so thick. Iâ€™ve had both pans in the over for an hour now, the top and sides are really done and kind of crispy but the inside is still raw. What did I do wrong???
This recipes is blah at best. Zero flavor. I added shredded coconut but wish I would have added crushed pineapple too. Oddly doesnâ€™t taste like thereâ€™s any sugar. So disappointed.
Very good. Will use less salt next time but was still a keeper for sure!
I didn't add nuts to the icing.
This was amazing! I did add some all spice. Other then that 10/10
I always get compliments on this cake! It is so delicious!

I made this recipe exactly as listed and it was literally AWFUL! It was super dry, had absolutely no flavor and if Iâ€™m being completely honest, it tasted like frosted dirt. The frosting is the only good thing about this recipe and I was super embarrassed to serve this at my husbandâ€™s birthday. If I could give it negative stars, I definitely would.
So tasty. I didnâ€™t add the whole amount of the sugar and it was sweet enough.
It tastes chemical, very bitter, and it made a MESS in the oven. Please, donâ€™t bake it, youâ€™ll waste your money and time!
The recipe is not good. Itâ€™s too sweet also the time mentioned is too much and my cake was burnt even after following everything to the T

I loved this recipe. I followed it exactly (aside from reducing the amount of sugar in the icing). It turned out amazing. 
I feel that if you change the recipe, and then give it a 1 star, you haven't done the recipe justice. Like I said, I followed it exactly and it was amazing. I've made it multiple times now.

Amazing carrot cake recipe! I wouldn't change a thing! A tip: squeeze at much of the juice out of the the carrots as you can before mixing it in and the cake won't be overly wet and soggy in the middle. I used two round pans vs. a 9X13 to stack them. Came out perfect!

Too much Baking Powder/Soda. I used fresh ingredients exactly as the recipe indicated. The cake had a metallic flavor.

. 
Both my Baking Soda and Powder were just purchased. Also I use aluminum-free Baking Powder. 

I saw most comments where people adjusted and or added ingredients (like Pineapple) That probably added enough acid to counteract the excess Powder/Soda.

I find it dis-heartening to see a recipe with 5 Stars , when most of the reviewers added/adjusted the recipe.
awesome, easy, family loved it
Was simple to make and tasted great! I did add crushed pineapple, kept the recipe the same other than that. Made the cream cheese frosting as well. Would make again.
Easy to make and tasty.
Delightful cake. Did a 3 layer. Made all the changes suggested by gneebeanie with the exception of the carrots. I just used preshredded from the produce section.
Followed all the directions and it fell and turned to mush. Only positive thing I can say about it is it made the house smell good for a while lol
It's a strange tasting cake. It lacks depth and flavor. All you taste is a flat sweetness and baking soda. The recipe could use more salt, more flavor and definitely less baking soda

I have been making this cake for years now and have pointed many others to the recipe when they request it. Clearly I am not alone in calling it a winner. While I do sometimes use part brown sugar or add zucchini or pineapple, I have also made the recipe "as is" several times as is with excellent results.
I followed the recipe exactly and it came out absolutely delicious!

Great recipe. Very moist. Everyone loves it. Only changes I made was I used walnuts instead of pecans and I added 1 1/2 cups of dried cranberries. Will definitely be using this recipe again. I have tried many other carrot cake recipes and this is my favorite one.

Made this as a first time Baker. 
Everybody and their dog loved it. 
Highly recommended
It's so easy..

I followed this recipe to the detail. The good: it was easy to make & the cake was moist. The bad: the cake was bland & the frosting was overly sweet. My 8yo & 12yo thought it was too sweet. I thought it was too sweet & bland. My husband liked it but, then again, he also can't tell when cheese or milk goes bad. So there you go. One out of 5 stars. Would not make again.
Absolutely delicious! Have made several times. Always a winner. My 6 year old great granddaughter said, "this is soooo good!"
I followed the recipe and it's a bad recipe. The center of the cake didn't raise. Couldnt use it for my anniversary cake
Easy to make and tasty
so much oil but tasted good
This is the one and only carrot cake I will ever make and Iâ€™ve made many before. I buy grated carrots and chop them a bit finer in the food processor.

i loved this recipe , I added some carrot shreds and cinnamon on top and it was amazing!
10/10 recomend
